heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: The last storm was on 21 September 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 1.6°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 322 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 50.1°C), dew point temperature (up 45.8°C), outside temperature (up 49.7°C), and cloud levels (up 902 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 322.1m lower than yesterday, 902.4m lower than the past week, 484.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 929m to 2240m and averaged 1223.0m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the air will feel dry and very little to no wind will be present. Possible light showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and it’s dim outside. Similar weather conditions should remain.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (5.4°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
